text.div:
MessageOML_O21toBundle (http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/v2mappings/message-oml-o21-to-bundle)

Mapping from OML_O21 to Bundle

ACTIVE (not intended for production usage). Published on 2022-02-21 by HL7 International, Inc (HL7 Orders and Observations Workgroup: http://hl7.org/Special/committ..., Keith W. Boone: kboone@ainq.com). Copyright (c) 2020, HL7 International, Inc., All Rights Reserved.

This ConceptMap represents a mapping from the HL7 V2 Message OML_O21 to the FHIR Message Bundle.


Source Concept DetailsRelationshipDestination Concept DetailsComment
Code from Code from Code from Code from Code from Code from Code from
OML_O21.MSHMessage HeaderMSH[Bundle]is equivalent toBundleBundle
OML_O21.MSHMessage HeaderMSH[MessageHeader]is equivalent toMessageHeader[1]MessageHeader[1]Processing of the MSH segment results in the creation of a new MessageHeader resource
OML_O21.MSHMessage HeaderMSH[Provenance]Provenance.target=Bundle; Provenance.target=MessageHeader[MSH]is equivalent toProvenance[1]Provenance[1]
OML_O21.SFTSoftwareSFT[MessageHeader]is equivalent toMessageHeader[1]MessageHeader[1]Incorporate SFT content for each of the SFT instances into the MessageHeader created from the MSH segment.
OML_O21.PATIENT.PIDPatient IdentificationPID[Patient]is equivalent toPatient[1]Patient[1]Processing of the PID segment results in the creation of a new Patient resource
OML_O21.PATIENT.PIDPatient IdentificationPID[Provenance]Provenance.target.reference=Patient[1].idis equivalent toProvenance[4]Provenance[4]IF PID-33 AND PID-34 VALUEDOne may drop PID-33 from the condition if PID-34 Last Update Facility is still sufficient without a date.
OML_O21.PATIENT.PD1Additional DemographicsPD1[Patient]is equivalent toPatient[1]Patient[1]Incorporate PD1 content into the Patient created from the PID segment.
OML_O21.PATIENT.PRTParticipation (for Patient)PRT[PractitionerRole]Patient[1].generalPractitioner.reference=PractitionerRole[1].idis equivalent toPractitionerRole[1]PractitionerRole[1]IF PRT-4.1 EQUALS "PP" AND PRT-4.3 EQUALS "HL70443"(element("4.1")="PP")and(element("4.3")="HL70443")Incorporate PRT content into the Patient created from the PID segment when the PRT contains practitioner related data.
OML_O21.PATIENT.PRTParticipation (for Patient)PRT[RelatedPerson]RelatedPerson[1].patient.reference=Patient[1].idis equivalent toRelatedPerson[1]RelatedPerson[1]IF PRT-4.1 NOT EQUALS "PP" OR PRT-4.3 NOT EQUALS "HL70443"(element("4.1"!)="PP")or(element("4.3")!="HL70443")
OML_O21.PATIENT.NK1Next of Kin/Associated PartiesNK1[RelatedPerson]RelatedPerson[2].patient.reference=Patient[1].idis equivalent toRelatedPerson[2]RelatedPerson[2]The FHIR location will depend on the nature of the data being exchanged and how the systems use next of kin dataTypically, each NK1 will be translated to either a new RelatedPerson resource or added as a new occurrence of Patient.contact, but it's possible to insert the NK1 data into both structures.
OML_O21.PATIENT.NK1Next of Kin/Associated PartiesNK1[Patient]is equivalent toPatient[1]Patient[1]The FHIR location will depend on the nature of the data being exchanged and how the systems use next of kin dataTypically, each NK1 will be translated to either a new RelatedPerson resource or added as a new occurrence of Patient.contact, but it's possible to insert the NK1 data into both structures.
OML_O21.PATIENT.PATIENT_VISIT.PV1Patient VisitPV1[Encounter]Encounter.subject=Patient[PID]is equivalent toEncounter[1]Encounter[1]Processing of the PV1 segment results in the creation of a new Encounter resource
OML_O21.PATIENT.PATIENT_VISIT.PV1Patient VisitPV1[Patient]is equivalent toPatient[1]Patient[1]
OML_O21.PATIENT.PATIENT_VISIT.PV2Patient Visit- Additional InfoPV2[Encounter]is equivalent toEncounter[1]Encounter[1]Incorporate PV2 content into the Encounter created from the PV1 segment.
OML_O21.PATIENT.PATIENT_VISIT.PRTParticipation (for Patient Visit)PRT[PractitionerRole]Encounter[1].participant.individual.reference=PractitionerRole[2].idis equivalent toPractitionerRole[2]PractitionerRole[2]Incorporate PRT content into the Encounter created from the PV1 segment.
OML_O21.PATIENT.INSURANCE.IN1InsuranceIN1[Coverage]Coverage.subscriber=Patient[PID]is equivalent toCoverage[1]Coverage[1]Processing of the IN1 segment results in the creation of a new Coverage resource
OML_O21.PATIENT.INSURANCE.IN2Insurance Additional InformationIN2[Coverage]is equivalent toCoverage[1]Coverage[1]Incorporate IN2 content into the Coverage created from the IN1 segment.
OML_O21.PATIENT.INSURANCE.IN3Insurance Additional Information, CertificationIN3[Coverage]is equivalent toCoverage[1]Coverage[1]Incorporate IN3 content into the Coverage created from the IN1 segment.
OML_O21.PATIENT.AL1Allergy InformationAL1AllergyIntolerance.patient=Patient[PID]is equivalent toAllergyIntoleranceAllergyIntoleranceProcessing of the AL1 segment results in the creation of a new AllergyIntolerance resource
OML_O21.ORDER.ORCCommon OrderORC[ServiceRequest]ServiceRequest.subject=Patient[PID]is equivalent toServiceRequest[1]ServiceRequest[1]Processing of each ORC segment results in the creation of a new ServiceRequest resource
OML_O21.ORDER.ORCCommon OrderORC[Provenance]Provenance.target=ServiceRequest[ORC]is equivalent toProvenance[3]Provenance[3]Using Provenance is the preferred way, but a local implementation may decide to add extensions to the main resource. As the use and guidance of Provenance matures we wil revisit this later.
OML_O21.ORDER.PRTParticipation (for Common Order)PRT[PractitionerRole]ServiceRequest[1].requester.reference=PractitionerRole[3].idis equivalent toPractitionerRole[3]PractitionerRole[3]IF PRT-4.1 EQUALS "OP" AND PRT-4.3 EQUALS "HL70443"(element("4.1")="OP")and(element("4.3")="HL70443")
OML_O21.ORDER.TIMING.TQ1Timing/QuantityTQ1[ServiceRequest]is equivalent toServiceRequest[1]ServiceRequest[1]
OML_O21.ORDER.TIMING.TQ2Timing/Quantity Order SequenceTQ2[ServiceRequest]is equivalent toServiceRequest[1]ServiceRequest[1]
OML_O21.ORDER.OBSERVATION_REQUEST.OBRObservation RequestOBR[ServiceRequest]is equivalent toServiceRequest[1]ServiceRequest[1]Incorporate OBR content into the ServiceRequest created from the ORC segment in the same segment group.
OML_O21.ORDER.OBSERVATION_REQUEST.OBRObservation RequestOBR[Specimen]is equivalent toSpecimen[each]Specimen[each]
OML_O21.ORDER.OBSERVATION_REQUEST.NTENotes and Comments (for Detail)NTE[ServiceRequest]is equivalent toServiceRequest[1]ServiceRequest[1]
OML_O21.ORDER.OBSERVATION_REQUEST.PRTParticipation (for Observation Request)PRT[PractitionerRole]ServiceRequest[1].specimen[1](Specimen.collection.collector.reference)=PractitionerRole[4].idis equivalent toPractitionerRole[4]PractitionerRole[4]IF PRT-4.1 EQUALS "SC" AND PRT-4.3 EQUALS "HL70443"(element("4.1")="SC")and(element("4.3")="HL70443")
OML_O21.ORDER.OBSERVATION_REQUEST.PRTParticipation (for Observation Request)PRT[PractitionerRole]ServiceRequest[1].requester.reference=PractitionerRole[3].idis equivalent toPractitionerRole[3]PractitionerRole[3]IF PRT-4.1 EQUALS "OP" AND PRT-4.3 EQUALS "HL70443"(element("4.1")="OP")and(element("4.3")="HL70443")
OML_O21.ORDER.OBSERVATION_REQUEST.DG1DiagnosisDG1[Condition]ServiceRequest[1].reasonReference.reference=Condition[1].id; Condition[1].subject.reference=Patient[1].idis equivalent toCondition[1]Condition[1]Processing of the DG1 segment results in the creation of a new Condition resource which is referenced in the ServiceRequest created by the ORC segment
OML_O21.ORDER.OBSERVATION_REQUEST.OBSERVATION.OBXObservation/ResultOBX[Observation]ServiceRequest[1].supportingInfo.reference=Observation[1].id; Observation[1].subject.id=Patient[1].idis equivalent toObservation[1]Observation[1]IF OBX-29 IN ("QST", "SCI")
OML_O21.ORDER.OBSERVATION_REQUEST.OBSERVATION.PRTParticipation (for OBX)PRT[Device]Observation[2].device.reference=Device.idis equivalent toDeviceDeviceIF PRT-10 VALUED
OML_O21.ORDER.OBSERVATION_REQUEST.OBSERVATION.PRTParticipation (for OBX)PRT[Observation-Location]is equivalent toObservation[2]Observation[2]IF PRT-9 VALUED OR IF PRT-14 VALUEDIncorporate PRT content into the Observation created from the OBX segment in the same segment group when it represents observation location information.
OML_O21.ORDER.OBSERVATION_REQUEST.OBSERVATION.PRTParticipation (for OBX)PRT[PractitionerRole]Observation[2].performer.reference=PractitionerRole[7].idis equivalent toPractitionerRole[7]PractitionerRole[7]IF PRT-5 VALUEDIncorporate PRT content into the Observation created from the OBX segment in the same segment group when it represents observation practitioner information.
OML_O21.ORDER.OBSERVATION_REQUEST.OBSERVATION.NTENotes and Comments (for Results)NTE[Observation]is equivalent toObservation[1]Observation[1]
OML_O21.ORDER.OBSERVATION_REQUEST.SPECIMEN.SPMSpecimenSPM[Specimen]ServiceRequest[1].specimen.reference=Specimen[SPM].idis equivalent toSpecimenSpecimen

name: MessageOML_O21toBundle
description: This ConceptMap represents a mapping from the HL7 V2 Message OML_O21 to the FHIR Message Bundle.
copyright: Copyright (c) 2020, HL7 International, Inc., All Rights Reserved.

target.comment: Processing of the MSH segment results in the creation of a new MessageHeader resource
Incorporate SFT content for each of the SFT instances into the MessageHeader created from the MSH segment.
Processing of the PID segment results in the creation of a new Patient resource

product.value: One  may drop PID-33 from the condition if PID-34 Last Update Facility is still sufficient without a date.

target.comment: Incorporate PD1 content into the Patient created from the PID segment.
Incorporate PRT content into the Patient created from the PID segment when the PRT contains practitioner related data.

product.value: IF PRT-4.1 EQUALS "PP" AND PRT-4.3 EQUALS "HL70443"
IF PRT-4.1 NOT EQUALS "PP" OR PRT-4.3 NOT EQUALS "HL70443"

target.comment: Typically, each NK1 will be translated to either a new RelatedPerson resource or added as a new occurrence of Patient.contact, but it's possible to insert the NK1 data into both structures.

product.value: The FHIR location will depend on the nature of the data being exchanged and how the systems use next of kin data

target.comment: Typically, each NK1 will be translated to either a new RelatedPerson resource or added as a new occurrence of Patient.contact, but it's possible to insert the NK1 data into both structures.

product.value: The FHIR location will depend on the nature of the data being exchanged and how the systems use next of kin data

target.comment: Processing of the PV1 segment results in the creation of a new Encounter resource
Incorporate PV2 content into the Encounter created from the PV1 segment.
Incorporate PRT content into the Encounter created from the PV1 segment.
Processing of the IN1 segment results in the creation of a new Coverage resource
Incorporate IN2 content into the Coverage created from the IN1 segment.
Incorporate IN3 content into the Coverage created from the IN1 segment.
Processing of the AL1 segment results in the creation of a new AllergyIntolerance resource
Processing of each ORC segment results in the creation of a new ServiceRequest resource
Using Provenance is the preferred way, but a local implementation may decide to add extensions to the main resource.  As the use and guidance of Provenance matures we wil revisit this later.

product.value: IF PRT-4.1 EQUALS "OP" AND PRT-4.3 EQUALS "HL70443"

target.comment: Incorporate OBR content into the ServiceRequest created from the ORC segment in the same segment group.

product.value: IF PRT-4.1 EQUALS "SC" AND PRT-4.3 EQUALS "HL70443"
IF PRT-4.1 EQUALS "OP" AND PRT-4.3 EQUALS "HL70443"

target.comment: Processing of the DG1 segment results in the creation of a new Condition resource which is referenced in the ServiceRequest created by the ORC segment
Incorporate PRT content into the Observation created from the OBX segment in the same segment group when it represents observation location information.

product.value: IF PRT-9 VALUED OR IF PRT-14 VALUED

target.comment: Incorporate PRT content into the Observation created from the OBX segment in the same segment group when it represents observation practitioner information.
